Comments_List: In this course I was exposed for the first time to the discipline of religious studies and was immediately intrigued by it. Besides what I learned about apocalypticism, I was also indebted to this course for igniting my curiosity about the ancient world.

I appreciate the fact that the professors approach the texts with the context in mind without being historicist. Bringing in texts from various religious traditions also helps the students understand the prevalence of apocalyptic thinking and its relevance to the contemporary world. It is wonderful that the theme of apocalcypticism is examined with an interdisciplinary approach, with a focus on the fundamental texts and issues transcending disciplinary boundaries.
Students with an interest in philosophy, religious studies, intellectual history, and the ancient world would learn much in this course.
